text.more: Thematic categories as described in the paper: Category 1: Students’ mathematical modeling of physical phenomena. Category 2: Role of mathematics in physics teaching. Category 3: Mathematics as a representation for physics. Category 4: Students’ understanding/interpretation of mathematical concepts in physics contexts. Category 5: Statistical analyses of relations between mathematics and physics achievement. Category 6: Conceptions about the relationship of mathematics and physics. Category 7: Historical and philosophical accounts of the role of mathematics in physics. Category 8: Use of mathematics in physics problem solving. A network map with framework codes (n = 18), context codes (n=9),  articles (n = 122), and links between articles and codes (n = 330). 
Size of nodes is proportional to the number of the node’s connections. 
Colors indicate the thematic category assigned to each article and context/framework nodes. 
Click on nodes to see connections. 
Click on article nodes to get more information about the study.
